message.raw:
Fixed a bug where importing an entire module from labscript could try and save the contents of the __init__ file twice in the HDF5 file. Now labscript only saves import contents if it isn't already saved in the HDF5 file.

Also added is a type cnversion of globals from numpy._bool to bool, and the exp_ramp and exp_t_ramp functions have been modified to use truncation if "trunc is not False". This ensures that you can successfully truncate at trunc=0, which previously evaluated as False due to the if statement being "if trunc:"

Also added is a type cnversion of globals from numpy._bool to bool, and the exp_ramp and exp_t_ramp functions have been modified to use truncation if "trunc is not False". This ensures that you can successfully truncate at trunc=0, which previously evaluated as False due to the if statement being "if trunc:"

message:

Also added is a type cnversion of globals from numpy._bool to bool, and the exp_ramp and exp_t_ramp functions have been modified to use truncation if "trunc is not False". This ensures that you can successfully truncate at trunc=0, which previously evaluated as False due to the if statement being "if trunc:"
